title: A Natural First Aid Kit — Ayurvedic Balms That Work
author: Harish
excerpt: Ayurvedic balms with turmeric and neem are powerful natural solutions for minor cuts, scrapes, and bites. Here’s how to use them safely.
content:
Why Ayurveda Trusts Turmeric and Neem

Turmeric has been used for centuries for its wound-healing, anti-inflammatory properties. Neem adds antimicrobial power, helping protect minor cuts and scrapes from infection. Together they form a simple yet effective first-aid combo.

What Does an Herbal First Aid Balm Do?

This balm gently coats the affected area, reducing redness and helping the body’s natural repair process. Coconut oil adds nourishment while beeswax forms a protective layer.

Where to Use It

  • Minor cuts & abrasions
  • Insect bites
  • Rashes
  • Small burns (after cooling)

How to Apply

  1. Clean the area with water.
  2. Pat dry.
  3. Apply a thin layer of balm.
  4. Repeat 1–2 times daily as needed.

When to See a Doctor

If the wound is deep, bleeding heavily, or shows signs of infection (pus, swelling, fever), seek professional medical care. Herbal balms are for minor concerns only.
